questions.text: Which sentence uses the correct form of the verb?
options: She go to the market every day.
She goes to the market every day.
She going to the market every day.
She gone to the market every day.
questions.explanation: The subject 'she' requires the verb 'go' to be conjugated as 'goes' in the present tense for third-person singular.

questions.text: Identify the correct use of the possessive pronoun.
questions.explanation: The possessive pronoun 'your' is correctly used here without any apostrophe.

questions.text: Which of the following is a complete sentence?
questions.explanation: A complete sentence must have a subject and a predicate; 'He finished his homework' fulfills this criterion.

questions.text: Choose the sentence with correct subject-verb agreement.
options: The team are playing well today.
The team is playing well today.
The team were playing well today.
The team has playing well today.
questions.explanation: When referring to a team as a single entity, the singular verb 'is' should be used.

questions.text: Which of the following sentences uses an adjective correctly?
questions.explanation: The adjective 'fluent' describes the noun 'English' correctly in this sentence.

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of a compound sentence?
options: She likes tea, and he prefers coffee.
While drinking tea, she read a book.
questions.explanation: A compound sentence has two independent clauses joined by a conjunction, such as 'and.'

Which sentence uses the correct article?
options: I saw an elephant in the zoo.
I saw a elephant in the zoo.
I saw the elephant in a zoo.
I saw elephant in a zoo.
questions.explanation: The article 'an' is used before words beginning with a vowel sound like 'elephant.'

questions.text: Choose the sentence with the correct punctuation.
questions.explanation: An exclamation mark is appropriate for expressing strong feelings or excitement.

questions.text: Identify the sentence written in passive voice.
options: The cat was chased by the dog.
The dog is chasing the cat.
The cat is chasing the dog.
questions.explanation: A sentence is in the passive voice when the subject is acted upon, as in 'The cat was chased by the dog.'

questions.text: Choose the correct form of the verb: She _____ to the store yesterday.
questions.explanation: In past simple tense, the correct form is 'went'.

questions.text: Which sentence uses the correct article?
options: I saw an unicorn in the garden.
I saw a unicorn in the garden.
I saw the unicorn in garden.
I saw unicorn in the garden.
questions.explanation: We use 'a' before words beginning with consonant sounds. Although 'unicorn' starts with 'u', it makes a consonant 'y' sound.
